entry.title: Assistance Required: Issues with SCI Check Process and Virus Scan Warning in SAP
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am new to performing SCI checks in the SAP system and am currently facing an issue. Could someone please guide me through the process of performing SCI checks?

While executing the SCI check, I encountered a warning message: "Cannot Perform inspection: Virus scanner cannot be instantiated: Virus scan profile /SMIM_API/Put is not active." Since it is a warning, I proceeded further, but the results showed that no objects were processed, displaying zero. I have attached a snapshot of the result for your reference.

Could anyone advise on how to resolve this warning and ensure the SCI check processes the objects correctly? Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you,
khaza Mohammad

entry.title: How to configure SSO from Salesforce to SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm currently looking for a way to configure Single Sign-On (SSO) from Salesforce to SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud. Unfortunately, I haven’t been able to find any official documentation that directly addresses this specific integration.

The closest reference I found is a guide on configuring SSO from Salesforce to SAP HANA, but not specifically SAP S/4HANA in a private cloud environment.

If anyone has experience with this setup or can point me to relevant documentation or best practices, I’d greatly appreciate your help.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Sap Analytics Cloud - Security for an end user to be able to upload data using an upload job
entry.content:
Hello, 

I'm having issues configuring the role for the end user to be able to upload data to the Planning Model through an upload job. 

I have the user with the Modeler role and the next things on: 

he following permissions are required to import data into a model:

  • Create permission on either Analytic Model or Planning Model.
  • Execute permission on Personal Data Acquisition.
    => Without this permission, you cannot choose option "Import a file from your computer" to create a new model.
  • Create and Read permissions on Connection.
    => Without the two permission, you will get error message "The upload failed due to an unexpected internal server error. Please try again later. If the problem persists, please contact your system administrator" when uploading file.
  • Create permission on Dimension.
    => Without this permission, you will get error message like "Model <dimension name> creation has failed. <...> "error":"You are not authorized to Create Dimension <dimension name>."" when creating model.
  • Users also need the Read and Maintain model permissions to upload/change data for existing models. See Model and Version Security and Model Administration Scenarios.
  • Users need permissions in two places in order to perform actions on a model: they need the general application permission (via role) to Read, Update, Delete, or Maintain analytic or planning models, and they also need the Read, Update, Delete, or Maintain permission granted via the Sharing Settings directly on the model itself.

But the upload job is still rejecting all the data due to data access control.

I also have the users in the read and write dimmension: Audti trail, business area and company. Dimmensions that in my model have security on. 

Any ideas what can be happening? 

 

Thank you.

entry.title: SSO Issue
entry.content:
Dear SAP Team,

SAML SSO is working fine with AD email id (e.g ***REMOVED BY MODERATION***). Without AD user id how to login Fiori url? can its possible?   

User are login SAP GUI with Employee user id( ***REMOVED BY MODERATION***). Its possible Fiori URL login to Employee user id( ***REMOVED BY MODERATION***)? When i open the below Fiori URL 

https://nonprodfiori.himalayawellness.com:44380/sap/bc/ui5_ui5/ui2/ushell/shells/abap/FioriLaunchpad.html?sap-client=120&sap-language=EN#Shell-home

Its redirect to Microsoft https://login.microsoftonline.com/. How to login above fiori url with login employee user id( ***REMOVED BY MODERATION***)? 

Our requirement is Fiori URL login both with AD user id( ***REMOVED BY MODERATION***) and SAP Logon User id( ***REMOVED BY MODERATION***) below URL. Its possible ?

 https://nonprodfiori.himalayawellness.com:44380/sap/bc/ui5_ui5/ui2/ushell/shells/abap/FioriLaunchpad.html?sap-client=120&sap-language=EN#Shell-home

Thanks

Munna

entry.title: Security Vulnerability in SAP Crystal Reports for Eclipse (JAVA) SP31 - CVE-2025-46392
entry.content:
Hello

Regarding Crystal report for eclipse (java) - SP31;

There is a vulnerability CVE-2025-46392 in file:
lib/commons-configuration-1.2.jar

CVE details: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption vulnerability in Apache Commons Configuration 1.x.

All versions of commons-configuration have this vulnerability: 
https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/commons-configuration/commons-configuration

Commons configurations2 does not have this vulnerability:
https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.commons/commons-configuration2

Please can this be fixed in a new service pack SP32 for Eclipse (Java)? And if so, when could we expect this fix?

Thank you,

entry.title: Security configuration for wro4j
entry.content:
Hi,

Recently we got an absurd intermittent issue where one of the theme CSS file is unable to load.

The issue happened only on prod multiple times but intermittently. Generally everything works fine but once in a while the CSS file response returns a login page html code. This makes one of the developer think that there may be some security issue on the css file. The file path on storefront is under /wro/ provided dynamically according to the site url based theme selection.

So, he suggested to include below in ourstorefront/web/webroot/WEB-INF/config/spring-security-config.xml

<security:http pattern="/wro/**" security="none" />

The idea is that the dev expects that instead of receiving a login page html code he would get the actual error when the issue would occur.

The change seems quite generic and we think that if it would have been required, SAP team would have done it already. So, we aren't sure of whether this is something which can introduce more issues or can help in.

Please let us know the thoughts if this change seems okay to implement or not.

entry.title: In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public edition unable to deactivate "Create Inbound delivery" app

Can you please suggest why we are not able to deactivate "Create Inbound delivery" app ?

entry.title: Questions regarding attribute mapping multiple values
entry.content:
Hi Colleagues,

We are XSUAA-based application and migrating to XSUAA+IAS authentication mode. We had implemented market-related restriction for user, e.g., user only assigned with US market cannot see information in other market. This was implemented (in XSUAA) as role template allowing create a role with a list of market IDs. For example, i can create a role restrict_market_1 including market id A1, A2, A3. User can only access relevant markets.


However, after moved to IAS+XSUAA, we mapped attributes from the role collection and create a role in XSUAA referring an attribute in IAS called "subscriptionBillingMarket".


And the attribute "subscriptionBillingMarket" is defined in the application self-defined attributes as:

and for each Custom Attribute i can input only one market id which badly limit the functionality. I am wondering if IAS have a function that create a list of values so that i can pass back to XSUAA as market id list? or any similar implementation regarding market auth. Thanks

Regards,
Spencer

entry.title: Need Best Practices of ABAP Access to Production Environment
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team

 

Our external auditors have raised a concern that they will not rely on SAP for the financial audit. The issue identified is that the ABAP user currently has access to the production environment, which they consider a violation of control.

 

In light of the above, I request your support in providing the relevant SAP standards or best practices on this matter, preferably referenced in an SAP Note. This is critical, as the system was implemented primarily for financial controlling, and the auditors’ non-reliance on SAP for financials would undermine its purpose.

 

Your prompt response will be highly appreciated.

 



Thanks

entry.title: Authorisation roles conflicting
entry.content:
Hi there,

I have a question regarding authorisation roles. I have created two authorisation roles for the BP transactions which are as follows

  1. Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_1

With this role, I have restricted editing of the Address details using the authorisation objects B_BUPA_ATT & B_BUPA_FDG. Users with this role can edit the field groups for the BP with the account groups Z001, Z002, Z003, Z005 & Z009 in B_BUPA_ATT, as shown in the screenshot below.

  1. Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_2

With this role, I have allowed full access to the users to edit all field groups for the BP under the account group Z004. Therefore, users with this role can edit all details in the BP if the BP account group is Z004.

Both roles are functioning as expected when assigned as the only role to the user. However, when I assign both roles to a user, the User can edit all field groups in the BP address for the account groups Z001, Z002, Z003, Z005 & Z009, which are restricted in the Z_SAP_FIN_ROLE_1. Can anyone please advise on how to maintain separate, editable field groups for each account group if both roles are assigned to the same user? Both roles need to be assigned to the same user.

Thanks
Faraz

entry.title: Can you tell me what authoirzation is missing for this SU53 screenshot
Population of field TECHDESC in table USR21
entry.content:
Since recent upgrade to SAP S/4HANA, we have noticed that some workflows are checking for a value in field TECHDESC in table USR21.

In table USR21 field TECHDESC, we have records that are populated with First Name & Last Name, and we have blank records in that field also.

We would like to know what is the data flow path / update mechanism, for the field TECHDESC to get populated with a value?  Is there a link to HR infotype to obtain the person's first name & last name?

entry.title: TCDCOUPLES, SE97, source and target transaction of FI GL document
entry.content:
Hi, 

FI GL doc contains the reference transaction that  was used to post this document.

There are settings in the table TCDCOUPLES that specifies the original transaction that a user is authorized and the final transaction called by the original one .

Lets say, a user is authorized to transaction XXX that has a mapping in the table  TCDCOUPLES to call transaction YYY. The transaction YYY is actually visible in the FI GL doc posted while the original transaction XXX isn't visible anywhere. IS there a way to trace the original transaction XXX?    

Thanks 

__PRESENT
